name: W - Write to File
description: W command in Linux is used to show who is logged on and what they are doing. This command provides a quick summary of every user logged into a computer, what each user is currently doing, and what load all the activity is imposing on the computer itself. It displays details like userâ€™s login name, the terminal line they are using, login time, idle time, JCPU, PCPU, and the command line of their current process.
